title: Mourner Headquarters

properties.value: The Mourner Headquarters, also known as the Mourner HQ, is the headquarters of the Prifddinas Death Guard, also known as the Mourners, in the north-eastern part of West Ardougne. The Mourner Tunnels, in which may be found the Mourner Tunnels mine as well as an entrance to the Temple of Light, are accessed from the basement of the building, through a restricted-access trapdoor.

The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Mourner Headquarters
Mourner Headquarters
Released23 October 2002 (Update)
MembersYes
Floors3
LocationWest Ardougne
Map
Advanced data
Typebuilding, dungeon

The Mourner Headquarters, also known as the Mourner HQ, is the headquarters of the Prifddinas Death Guard, also known as the Mourners, in the north-eastern part of West Ardougne. The Mourner Tunnels, in which may be found the Mourner Tunnels mine as well as an entrance to the Temple of Light, are accessed from the basement of the building, through a restricted-access trapdoor.

The Mourner Headquarters serves as the base for the military and strategic activities of the Iorwerth elves during the later part of the Elven Civil War. During this time, access to the headquarters is restricted only to those wearing only full Mourner gear, the standard uniform of a Mourner with rare exceptions.

After completion of Song of the Elves, knights of Ardougne now occupy the Headquarters. As a result, the mourners, who were actually Iorwerth elves, are now camped out in the Iorwerth Dungeon.

Access[edit | edit source]

The front entrance in West Ardougne can only be accessed while looking like a mourner, i.e. wearing full mourner gear and no other visible equipment. After partial completion of Mourning's End Part I, the player gains access to a set of full Mourner gear. After completion of Mourning's End Part II, a slayer ring can teleport the player to the Dark Beasts just west of the HQ basement. Mourner gear is not required to enter this way, though the mourners will be immediately aggressive.

The player must wear only Mourner gear to be allowed to enter the Mourner Headquarters, with limited exceptions for additional items that may also be worn. Any forbidden items can be kept in the inventory while entering. Attempting to enter while wearing full Mourner gear along with non-allowed items will result in a Mourner denying you entry, telling you that you should know better than to wear "non-regulation gear"—in other words, prohibited items, and you will be advised to take them off, in order to be allowed to enter. Attempting to enter while wearing only partial Mourner gear, or while wearing no Mourner gear, will cause the Mourners to recognise you as a non-Mourner, to ask who you are, and to ask you to go away.

Once inside the Mourner Headquarters, one can take off any Mourner gear and/or wear forbidden items without being thrown out. You will not be able to enter the trapdoor that leads to the basement without wearing full Mourner gear or while wearing any forbidden items; attempting to do so results in the message "The trapdoor is bolted on the other side." appearing in the chatbox. Inside the basement, you may not take off any Mourner gear or wear forbidden items. Attempting to talk to the Head Mourner while wearing full Mourner gear with any prohibited items, while wearing only partial Mourner gear, or while not wearing any Mourner gear will result in the Head Mourner recognising you as a human and calling for "Guards!", after which Mourners (level 108) wielding crystal halberds will come and attack you.

The basement can be accessed freely without Mourner gear after completion of Song of the Elves.

Acceptable items[edit | edit source]

In addition to full Mourner gear, the following may also be worn without being forbidden access to the Mourner Headquarters building:

  • Any ring
  • Enchanted gem
  • Blessings

Forbidden items[edit | edit source]

The following may not be worn by those seeking to enter the Mourner Headquarters building:

  • Any armour
  • Any boots
  • Any capes
  • Any gloves
  • Any weapons
  • Seal of passage

The '''Mourner Headquarters''', also known as the '''Mourner HQ''', is the headquarters of the Prifddinas Death Guard, also known as the [[Mourner]]s, in the north-eastern part of [[West Ardougne]]. The [[Mourner Tunnels]], in which may be found the [[Mourner Tunnels mine]] as well as an entrance to the [[Temple of Light]], are accessed from the basement of the building, through a restricted-access trapdoor.

The Mourner Headquarters serves as the base for the military and strategic activities of the Iorwerth [[elf|elves]] during the later part of the Elven Civil War. During this time, access to the headquarters is restricted only to those wearing only full [[Mourner gear]], the standard uniform of a [[Mourner]] with rare exceptions.

After completion of [[Song of the Elves]], [[knights of Ardougne]] now occupy the Headquarters. As a result, the mourners, who were actually Iorwerth elves, are now camped out in the [[Iorwerth Dungeon]].

==Access==
The front entrance in [[West Ardougne]] can only be accessed while looking like a mourner, i.e. wearing full mourner gear and no other visible equipment. After partial completion of [[Mourning's End Part I]], the player gains access to a set of full [[Mourner gear]]. After completion of [[Mourning's End Part II]], a [[slayer ring]] can teleport the player to the [[Dark Beast]]s just west of the HQ basement. Mourner gear is not required to enter this way, though the mourners will be immediately aggressive.

The player must wear only Mourner gear to be allowed to enter the Mourner Headquarters, with limited exceptions for additional items that may also be worn. Any forbidden items can be kept in the inventory while entering. Attempting to enter while wearing full Mourner gear along with non-allowed items will result in a Mourner denying you entry, telling you that you should know better than to wear "non-regulation gear"—in other words, prohibited items, and you will be advised to take them off, in order to be allowed to enter. Attempting to enter while wearing only partial Mourner gear, or while wearing no Mourner gear, will cause the Mourners to recognise you as a non-Mourner, to ask who you are, and to ask you to go away.

Once inside the Mourner Headquarters, one can take off any Mourner gear and/or wear forbidden items without being thrown out. You will not be able to enter the trapdoor that leads to the basement without wearing full Mourner gear or while wearing any forbidden items; attempting to do so results in the message "The trapdoor is bolted on the other side." appearing in the chatbox. Inside the basement, you may not take off any Mourner gear or wear forbidden items. Attempting to talk to the [[Head Mourner]] while wearing full Mourner gear with any prohibited items, while wearing only partial Mourner gear, or while not wearing any Mourner gear will result in the Head Mourner recognising you as a human and calling for "Guards!", after which Mourners (level 108) wielding [[crystal halberd]]s will come and attack you.

The basement can be accessed freely without Mourner gear after completion of Song of the Elves.

===Acceptable items===
In addition to full [[Mourner gear]], the following may also be worn without being forbidden access to the Mourner Headquarters building:
*Any [[ring]]
*[[Enchanted gem]]
*[[Blessings]]

===Forbidden items===
The following may not be worn by those seeking to enter the Mourner Headquarters building:
*Any [[armour]]
*Any [[boots]]
*Any [[cape]]s
*Any [[gloves]]
*Any [[weapon]]s
*[[Seal of passage]]
